metadata.title: CVE-2018-1999014 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg before commit bab0716c7f4793ec42e05a5aa7e80d82a0dd4e75 contains anout of array access vulnerability in MXF format demuxer that can result inDoS. This attack appear to be exploitable via specially crafted MXF filewhich has to be provided as input. This vulnerability appears to have beenfixed in bab0716c7f4793ec42e05a5aa7e80d82a0dd4e75 and later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1999014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.1-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.1-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.1-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.1-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.1-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.1-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.1-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.1-1').
gst-libav1.0 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
kino package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
